medical_history.chief_complaint: Subjective visual disturbances including halos, bluish tinge to vision, and increased sensitivity to light occurring after sildenafil administration.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient, a 69-year-old man, noted ocular disturbances 1 or 2 hours after administering 100 mg sildenafil. These disturbances began after he started taking sildenafil approximately 8 months prior and were described as lasting a few minutes without being excessively disturbing. Symptoms occurred with each ingestion of sildenafil.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension treated for 10 years; underwent radical prostatectomy for adenocarcinoma four years prior; taking sildenafil 100 mg every 1 or 2 weeks, along with 5 mg yohimbine and 400 mg pentoxifylline three times a day.
medical_history.family_history: Positive for glaucoma; negative for hereditary tapetoretinal degenerations.
